parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Spack",
  "details": {
    "job_scheduler": "Slurm",
    "job_name": "hypre@2.23.0",
    "account": "use300",
    "reservation": "root_73",
    "partition": "ind-gpu-shared",
    "nodes": 1,
    "tasks_per_node": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 10,
    "memory": "93G",
    "gpus": 1,
    "time": "00:30:00",
    "spack_version": "0.17.3",
    "spack_instance_name": "gpu",
    "spack_instance_version": "a",
    "spack_instance_dir": "/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.3/gpu/a",
    "spack_package": "hypre@2.23.0",
    "spack_compiler": "gcc@10.2.0",
    "spack_variants": "~complex +cuda cuda_arch=70,80 ~debug +fortran ~int64 ~internal-superlu ~mixedint +mpi ~openmp +shared +superlu-dist ~unified-memory",
    "spack_dependencies": "^openblas@0.3.18/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openblas@0.3.18 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ~ilp64 threads=none) ^superlu-dist@7.1.1/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' superlu-dist@7.1.1 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ^openmpi@3.1.6",
    "spack_spec": "hypre@2.23.0 % gcc@10.2.0 ~complex +cuda cuda_arch=70,80 ~debug +fortran ~int64 ~internal-superlu ~mixedint +mpi ~openmp +shared +superlu-dist ~unified-memory ^openblas@0.3.18/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openblas@0.3.18 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ~ilp64 threads=none) ^superlu-dist@7.1.1/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' superlu-dist@7.1.1 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ^openmpi@3.1.6",
    "system_name": "expanse"
  }
}
```

This script is running **Spack**, a package manager for scientific software. It utilizes Slurm as a job scheduler. 

The script defines several variables to configure the environment for the Spack installation. These include:

* `SPACK_VERSION`: The version of Spack being used.
* `SPACK_INSTANCE_NAME`: The name of the Spack instance.
* `SPACK_INSTANCE_VERSION`: The version of the Spack instance.
* `SPACK_INSTANCE_DIR`: The directory where the Spack instance is located.
* `SPACK_PACKAGE`: The name of the package being installed (hypre).
* `SPACK_COMPILER`: The compiler being used for the installation (gcc).
* `SPACK_VARIANTS`: The variants of the package being installed.
* `SPACK_DEPENDENCIES`: The dependencies of the package being installed.
* `SPACK_SPEC`: The complete specification of the package being installed.

The script uses Slurm commands to submit and manage the job. It also uses `module` commands to load the required modules, and `spack` commands to install the package. 

The script also sets up a temporary directory (`TMPDIR`) for staging the installation. 

The script finally submits a dependent job (`valgrind@3.17.0.sh`) after the hypre installation is completed.
